name: TheAtlantic
text: Trump is "the unrivaled master at institutional corruption. And his approach to bending the Justice Department to his will will be studied as long as politicians in power fear legal accountability," @benjaminwittes writes: https://t.co/kcKn2cxWzt

name: TheAtlantic
text: "I learned that just because I’m aware of the destruction caused by racism," @jemelehill writes, "that doesn’t mean I’m automatically sensitive to other forms of racism, or in this case, anti-Semitism." https://t.co/xpXaOUBngp

name: TheAtlantic
text: “What strikes me most in your letter is the contradiction between the joy you say your lover brings you and your description of how he treats you.” @LoriGottlieb1 advises a reader who is struggling to end her affair before moving away with her husband. https://t.co/98xzc1X5wd

name: TheAtlantic
text: Facing widespread criticism on Twitter, undergoing an internal workplace review, or having one’s book panned does not, in fact, erode one’s constitutional rights or endanger a liberal society, @ethiopienne argues. https://t.co/AhQxnOj64x

name: TheAtlantic
text: "As Americans are questioning the legitimacy of … the federal government, Roberts worked to ensure that the Supreme Court can be embraced by citizens of different perspectives as a neutral arbiter, guided by law rather than politics," @RosenJeffrey writes:https://t.co/kCdEIypnWu

name: TheAtlantic
text: Some mathematicians believe that the threshold for herd immunity could be lower than it originally seemed. But that will depend on us, writes @jameshamblin: https://t.co/lPGWtEZg8f

name: TheAtlantic
text: “The herd in question determines its immunity,” @JamesHamblin reports. “Even in the U.S., it’s not too late to create a world in which you are not likely to get the coronavirus.” https://t.co/ABRmO1Z1wb

name: TheAtlantic
text: “Even if it’s only on Tumblr, I want her to know that she’s not getting away with it": Meet the conspiracy theorists who believe that celebrities are faking their marriages, pregnancies, and even their children's existence. https://t.co/iVBdKK0oft

name: TheAtlantic
text: Herd immunity isn’t a static threshold. Here’s how to better think about it. The latest Atlantic Daily, by @mimbsy: https://t.co/ymPkDj9inu

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @AdamHSays: To be effective, efforts to combat systemic racism must stretch as far as the inequality itself does. 

My latest: https://t.co/3TKeDhdfE2

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @AdrienneLaF: “The endgame is no secret. The Polish ruling party dislikes existing entrepreneurs because it hopes to create its own oligarchs—businessmen who are dependent on government favors, a group that did not exist in Poland before now.” https://t.co/OBPgPuDmck

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @JeffreyGoldberg: Today is Harriet Beecher Stowe's birthday. One of the leading abolitionists of her time, she was also one of the founders of @TheAtlantic. Here is her 1863 article calling on the women of England to fight slavery:
https://t.co/PmDd8liZNK

name: TheAtlantic
text: North Carolinians were looking for online community once the pandemic hit, and they found it on Facebook in the form of ever-escalating suspicion and anger, @kait_tiffany reports. https://t.co/oIyuwOK5CW

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @AdamSerwer: It’s about much more than policing. Great piece from @AdamHSays https://t.co/RcPtQkWQEz

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @JeffreyGoldberg: This, from @Sulliview, is important:
https://t.co/d4gE9Rh9C2

name: TheAtlantic
text: As despair around reopening rises, the temptation to shame people who fail at social distancing becomes difficult to resist, @tesswilkry writes. “But Americans’ disgust should be aimed at governments and institutions, not at one another.” https://t.co/sXEDULb6tH

name: TheAtlantic
text: Americans took to the streets to protest police brutality, but the need for systemic reform runs much deeper, @AdamHSays writes: https://t.co/F2uXIMQb3S

name: TheAtlantic
text: Of course brands are happy to tweet about #BLM or fly a rainbow flag—because it costs them nothing. But beware splashy gestures when they leave power structures intact, says @helenlewis. https://t.co/i4Q9x5BgWC

name: TheAtlantic
text: Polish President Andrzej Duda won reelection in part by ginning up fear of LGBTQ people, a "brand-new political issue in Poland," @anneapplebaum writes: https://t.co/E10rwtkG1x

name: TheAtlantic
text:
The Trump administration has carried out the first federal execution in 17 years.

"The death penalty does not deter crime. It does not make our society safer,” S. Frank Thompson, a former prison superintendent, wrote in 2019. https://t.co/7iZg6oOrAQ
